title: Liverpool and England star Jordan Henderson reveals moment he broke down on pitch
text:
Sport Liverpool and England star Jordan Henderson reveals moment he broke down on pitch The 26-year-old is a leader for club and country but his journey into football didn't begin as you might think Share Jordan Henderson models the new England away kit (Photo: Lottie Bea Spencer 10/03/17 Liverpool) Share Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jordan Henderson has revealed he cried the first time he played football in a competitive environment. 
The Liverpool and England midfielder was six years old when his dad took him to take part in his first organised match - and it didn't quite go to plan. 
Speaking to The Players' Tribune, the now 26-year-old spoke of how he panicked so much that he ran off the pitch having only just come on as a substitute. 
"It would have been at the age of around six that my dad brought me along to my first youth match," Henderson said. "But things didn’t quite go as planned. I came on at half-time, but then just ran off the pitch and ended up in tears! 
"To be honest to this day I have no idea why. I didn’t hate football. I loved kicking the ball around, but I suppose when I got into a proper match I didn’t know what to do and I panicked. The manager had to bring another lad off the bench!" Henderson's first steps in football didn't quite go to plan... (Photo: Liverpool FC) ... but it all worked out for him in the end (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Thankfully for Henderson, he soon got the hang of things and went from strength so strength. 
So far his journey into football has seen him become the captain of Liverpool and a regular fixture in the England side. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
